# Draft:Illinois Warriors

Illinois Warriors is an elite AAU basketball club based in Illinois, founded and directed by Larry Butler since 1992. The program is known for its comprehensive youth basketball training and development, producing numerous top basketball talents who have progressed to collegiate and professional levels.
History
Larry Butler established the Warriors Athletic Program in 1992 with a focus on elite player development. His teams have won several elite national club championships and frequently competed at top national levels.
Notable NBA Alumni
The Illinois Warriors program has produced 21 NBA players including several prominent names:
Dwyane Wade
Andre Iguodala
Quentin Richardson
Shannon Brown
Dee Brown
Luther Head
Jon Schyer
Sharron Collins
Julian Wright
Matt Lottich
Darius Miles
These alumni reflect the program's impact on basketball talent development statewide and nationally.
Larry Butler
Larry Butler established the Warriors Athletic Program in 1992 with a focus on elite player development. His teams have won several elite national club championships and frequently competed at top national levels.
Larry Butler founded the Spot-Lite Scouting Service in 1993, which remains active providing scouting reports, statistics, and talent identification throughout Illinois. His data reaches more than 125 colleges and universities nationwide, connecting Illinois basketball talent with collegiate opportunities.
His dual role as a scout and coach has made a lasting impact on basketball talent development, helping cultivate a pipeline of elite players advancing to the collegiate and professional ranks.
